name: keyDown()
content:
Checks if the key specified is pressed.

Some interactive games use the keyboard for the user input to control the game.

examples.name: Rotary Phone
examples.description: A rotary phone dialer controlled by the keys 0 through 9.

examples.name: Driving
examples.description: Drive a square using the UP DOWN LEFT RIGHT keys.

palette_params.name: code
palette_params.description: The name of key you want to check. Keys without a letter or number have names like "up", "left", "shift", "tab", "space", etc.

short_description: Checks if the key specified is pressed.
tips: - When testing your games that use keyboard or mouse input make sure you click in the display area before you run, otherwise the Workspace will record your keyboard and mouse actions.
